snippet: It is possible for adults to process a language the same way a native speaker does, and over time, the processing improves even when the skill goes unused.
abstract: Michael Ullman study in journal PLoS One finds that contrary to common wisdom, adults can process a foreign language the same way a native speaker does, and that nativelike processing can improve even when the skill goes unused.
lead_paragraph: It is possible for adults to process a language the same way a native speaker does, and over time, the processing improves even when the skill goes unused.
